website_summaries.verdict: Designed for beginning climbers, these shoes have extra padding and sticky, resilient rubber soles to help you build skill and comfort. Remember, they're not for aggressive climbs and won't last forever.
pros: Constructed from leather with synthetic sole
Flat lasted construction for hours of performance and comfort
cons: These shoes may run wide, so size carefully when ordering

customer_reviews.title: Could be the right shoe for you!
customer_reviews.text: I have especially narrow and flat feet and felt there was too much volume in the heel, and on top of the foot. Velcro straps just couldnt get the fit tight/custom enough. That being said, it's a great quality shoe for the price, the leather feels great - if you have an average or wide foot it could be the perfect shoe! It does stretch 0.5-1 sizes so I would suggest getting a smaller size and letting them stretch out. I opted for the La Sportiva Finale in the end which fits me way better and has the adjustable laces for a snug fit
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: I loved them. I am an intermediate climber so I ...
customer_reviews.text: The reviews I read said to go up one size than normal for these shoes. I wear a 37 in my Mythos so ordered a 38. They were way too small so I exchanged them for a 39. Once I got the correct size, I loved them. I am an intermediate climber so I don't need anything super-aggressive but I can do 5.9-5.10 outside without hurting my feet.
customer_reviews.author: MarieC

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes a lot. I’m a street size 8 and I ordered a 9 and they fit perfect. I’m a beginner climbers do these have been working good for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, comfortable as far as climbing shoes go, my street shoe size is 6.5 and I got a 7 in these and they are appropriately snug but don't strangle my feet. Seem like they will hold up well for indoor climbing...
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, performs well.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 6 women's shoes. I got a size 6 and it fits just fine. As a beginner theses skies are all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Tong

customer_reviews.title: Fit well but they stretch
customer_reviews.text: My normal shoe size is 6.5 and I got a size 7. They are tight but not uncomfortable for now. I hope they don't stretch too much. ( They stretched out after two months. I should get a size 6.5. )
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Climbing shoes suppose to be pretty snug and feel tight. To me these shoes sized correctly, not small.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Vaszko

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Im a beginner and use these for indoor rock climbing. Fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rosario

customer_reviews.title: They're smaller than I'd like but it will do
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I knew I should've bought a bigger size just in case but I ended up going for the size 7's. Don't let the description fool you, yes these are womens shoes but they are mens sizes so make sure you're accounting for the size conversion when ordering. They're smaller than I'd like but it will do!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Graf

customer_reviews.title: They fit great but not as tight as they should fit
customer_reviews.text: I should've listened to my gut instinct and order a 37, but the reviews convinced me to do otherwise. Oh well. They fit great but not as tight as they should fit.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Torres

product_meta.title: SCARPA Women's Origin Wmn Climbing Shoe
product_meta.description:
The starting point in our climbing career is of fundamental importance. It gives rise to the genetic building blocks that shape our climbing lives. The origin offers a lush leather upper, giving a feeling of padded luxury that is rarely found in a shoe aimed at encouraging people to start climbing. The flat profile and relatively relaxed randing ease the climber's feet into a cocoon of comfort. The hook-and-loop closure keeps the foot snug and well positioned during use. The origin introduces scarpa's vision rubber, a proprietary compound that is both sticky and resilient to all the conditions that new climbers feet with experience.

Innovation and tradition share equally deep roots at SCARPA, a muti-generational, family-owned business whose headquarters and manufacturing facilities are in the same region of northern Italy where it was founded in 1938. SCARPA builds performance footwear for climbing, hiking, skiing, mountaineering, trail-running and other outdoor pursuits. Aside from being the Italian word for "shoe," SCARPA is an acronym for Societa Calzaturiera Asolana Riunita Pedemontana Anonima (Associated Shoe Manufacturing Company of the Asolo Mountain Area).
feature_bullets: Flat lasted construction delivers all-day comfort and performance
Dual strap closure allows for maximum adjustability
